text:
One pretty quaint lunch spot away from the more well-trafficked places in NTU campus, owned by a cheery middle aged couple. It's located in a concourse of the Experimental Medicine Building (third floor), accessible from the main North Spine complex from an overhead bridge.

Price is a bit more steep than in the cafeterias and they focus more on quality rather than portion size - perfect for dieting staffs and students. The menu is large - from pastries, sandwiches, cakes, wraps, cut fruits, coffee, and most importantly rice/pasta bowl with customizable topping (choices of meat, tofu, vegs). The pastries are served warm and fresh, and the bowl dishes' toppings are tasty. The coffee (espresso-based) is surprisingly pretty good and rather well-priced.

Can confirm sometimes there aren't enough seating during peak lunch time, albeit being situated inside a spacious concourse. More seating could be added so the customers can unwind.

It‚Äôs good and they‚Äôre realllyyy nice. But it‚Äôs expensive and the portion isn‚Äôt very big. $6.50 for a bowl (with chicken or tofu) and 3 toppings. They have brown rice which I really liked! But it‚Äôs not too much food.
They have lots of desserts like cake and banana bread.
Fresh Sandwiches, salads, wraps and a decent selection of drinks. Coffees are really worth the price. Good taste but probably insufficient for lunch for the price.

Favorite food and one of the favorite places in NTU!! Gonna miss there üò≠üò≠üò≠

Highly recommend to try this out!! It is like a hidden gem üòç
Less crowd. Chill atmosphere. Nice drinks and yummy food.
